intro: Erigeron mayoensis, commonly known as the Mayo fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disc flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall. Erigeron mayoensis is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid environments with minimal water.
